channel.title: Permanently switch Server 127.0.0.1 to your No-Ip?
channel.description:
Hey guys, I was wondering if there we as a way to switch this client to permanently have the 'server' from 127.0.0.1 to divinesouls.no-ip.biz
Like this:
http://s99.photobucket.com/albums/l283/Metal798_2006/?action=view&current=127001.jpg
To this:
http://s99.photobucket.com/albums/l283/Metal798_2006/?action=view&current=divinesouls.jpg
I don't want to constantly have to type in divinesouls.no-ip.biz I've searched through the client.java for both the server and the client, nothing came up for 127.0.0.1 besides two things, which I did change to divinesouls.no-ip.biz. This is didn't take effect on the client login screen though.

item.title: Permanently switch Server 127.0.0.1 to your No-Ip?
item.dc:creator: @Ahyo Ahyo
item.description:
@Ahyo wrote:

jaloko:

here. if you have a Byte searcher search for serverip if you have windows 7 you can search for it that way to. it will be in a file called GUI.java or in some cases EGUI.java look for those and use ctrl+f then search for serverip.

yeah what he said works for me too, i have windows 7

Read full topic
item.source: Permanently switch Server 127.0.0.1 to your No-Ip?

@jaloko wrote:

here. if you have a Byte searcher search for serverip if you have windows 7 you can search for it that way to. it will be in a file called GUI.java or in some cases EGUI.java look for those and use ctrl+f then search for serverip.

item.title: Permanently switch Server 127.0.0.1 to your No-Ip?
item.dc:creator: @Ahyo Ahyo
item.description:
@Ahyo wrote:

[quote=“DivineSouls, post:1, topic:352911”] Hey guys, I was wondering if there we as a way to switch this client to permanently have the ‘server’ from 127.0.0.1 to divinesouls.no-ip.biz

Like this:

To this:

I don’t want to constantly have to type in divinesouls.no-ip.biz
I’ve searched through the client.java for both the server and the client, nothing came up for 127.0.0.1 besides two things, which I did change to divinesouls.no-ip.biz. This is didn’t take effect on the client login screen though.[/quote]

Is it your server or is it someone else’s server?
If its yours when u start up the server you should just be able to open up ur client and not even type in a ip and it should load, thats what i do and it works. if that doesnt work try using the ip “00.000.00.00”, which should connect to the server YOU have up.

Read full topic
item.source: Permanently switch Server 127.0.0.1 to your No-Ip?

item.title: Permanently switch Server 127.0.0.1 to your No-Ip?
item.dc:creator: @dawnzpk3r dawnzpk3r
item.description:
@dawnzpk3r wrote:

Go to GUI in the client folder and look for “127.0.0.1” or “localhost” and change it to the server you want

Read full topic
